Major_Arcs.title: Introduction to the Circus and Paul Bunyan
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the circus setting, the character of Paul Bunyan, and the initial reactions of townspeople and visitors to the circus.

sub_scenes.title: Circus Performance Introduction
sub_scenes.description: Introduction of Paul Bunyan performing in the circus as a strongman.

sub_scenes.title: Townsman Hears of Circus
sub_scenes.description: A man in a checkered shirt learns about the circus and decides to visit.

narrative_arcs.title: Man Hears News of the Circus

sub_scenes.title: Family at the Circus
sub_scenes.description: A family is shown at the circus, reacting to a giraffe.

narrative_arcs.title: Family Reacts to Giraffe at Circus

Major_Arcs.title: Paul Bunyan Intervenes in Tent Trouble
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details the man in the checkered shirt, revealed to be Paul Bunyan, intervening in a threatening situation inside a circus tent and showcasing his strength.

sub_scenes.title: Investigation and Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: The man in the checkered shirt investigates sounds of trouble and confronts an aggressor in a tent.

sub_scenes.title: Fight and Revelation
sub_scenes.description: Paul Bunyan reveals his identity and uses his strength to defeat aggressors, even after being shot.

narrative_arcs.title: Pistol Threat and Revelation of Identity

Major_Arcs.title: Offer to Paul Bunyan to Become Circus Strongman
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the aftermath of the fight, where the circus owner offers Paul Bunyan a job as the new strongman.

sub_scenes.title: Aftermath and Backstory
sub_scenes.description: The circus owner expresses gratitude and explains the backstory of the conflict with Matto Grasso.

narrative_arcs.title: Gratitude and Revelation of Past Conflict

sub_scenes.title: The Circus Owner's Offer
sub_scenes.description: The circus owner proposes that Paul Bunyan become the circus's new strongman.

sub_scenes.title: Paul Bunyan Considers
sub_scenes.description: Paul Bunyan contemplates the circus owner's offer.

Major_Arcs.title: Matto Grasso's Arson and Foiled Plot
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc covers Matto Grasso's revenge plot against Paul Bunyan involving arson and Paul Bunyan's intervention to stop it.

sub_scenes.title: Matto's Revenge and Paul's Debut
sub_scenes.description: Paul Bunyan debuts as a strongman, while Matto Grasso plots revenge.

narrative_arcs.title: Paul Bunyan's Circus Debut and Matto Grasso's Envy

sub_scenes.title: Arson Plan
sub_scenes.description: Matto Grasso prepares to set the circus tent on fire.

sub_scenes.title: Fire and Paul's Intervention
sub_scenes.description: The circus tent catches fire, and Paul Bunyan swiftly puts it out.

narrative_arcs.title: Circus Tent Fire and Paul Bunyan's Swift Action

Major_Arcs.title: The Ape Incident and Chase
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details Matto Grasso's second revenge plan involving releasing an ape, Paul Bunyan's initial intervention, and the subsequent chase of the ape releaser.

sub_scenes.title: New Revenge Plan - Ape Release
sub_scenes.description: Matto Grasso devises a new plan to release a baby ape to cause chaos.

narrative_arcs.title: Matto Grasso's Frustration and a New Scheme

sub_scenes.title: Ape Release and Initial Stop
sub_scenes.description: The ape is released, but Paul Bunyan quickly intervenes to stop it.

narrative_arcs.title: The Ape's Release and Paul's Intervention

sub_scenes.title: The Chase Begins
sub_scenes.description: A circus worker chases the person who released the ape.

narrative_arcs.title: Entering the Arena and a New Plan

sub_scenes.title: Failed Attempts to Stop Chase
sub_scenes.description: The ape releaser tries to use a barbell and a hat trick to evade capture, but fails.

narrative_arcs.title: The Hat Trick and Continued Escape

Major_Arcs.title: Impromptu Fight and Paul's Farewell
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc covers an unscheduled fight during the circus performance, Paul Bunyan's intervention, his being offered a job, and his subsequent rejection and departure.

sub_scenes.title: The Unscheduled Fight Begins
sub_scenes.description: An impromptu fight breaks out in the circus arena.

sub_scenes.title: Escalation and Resolution of Fight
sub_scenes.description: The fight escalates dramatically, and Paul Bunyan intervenes to resolve it in a spectacular fashion.

sub_scenes.title: Offer and Rejection - Paul Leaves
sub_scenes.description: Paul Bunyan is offered the strongman position, but he declines and decides to return to the North Woods.

Major_Arcs.title: Marco Polo and the Ogress of Tibet Encounter
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new character, Marco Polo, and his adventurous past, focusing on an encounter with the Awful Ogress of Tibet.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction to Marco Polo's Adventure
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo's adventurous past and his encounter with the Awful Ogress are introduced.

narrative_arcs.title: Encounter with the Awful Ogress of Tibet

Major_Arcs.title: The Talking Severed Head
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc starts a new storyline with a man on horseback discovering a talking severed head in a forest.

sub_scenes.title: Discovery of the Severed Head
sub_scenes.description: A man on horseback discovers a severed head in the forest that is alive and talking.

Major_Arcs.title: Marco Polo's Journey to Hi-Toun
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Marco Polo's journey after the Ogress encounter, leading him to Hi-Toun and a city in mourning.

sub_scenes.title: Gratitude and Guidance
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo helps an old man who provides guidance to Hi-Toun and Princess Lotus.

narrative_arcs.title: Gratitude and Guidance from the Old Man

sub_scenes.title: Arrival at Mourning City
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo arrives at Hi-Toun and discovers the city is in mourning.

Major_Arcs.title: Marco Polo and the Ogress of Tibet Encounter (Continued)
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details Marco Polo's arrival in Hi-Toun, his encounter with the King, and his subsequent entrapment by the Ogress of Tibet.

sub_scenes.title: Welcome to Hi-Toun and King's Grief
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo is welcomed by the King of Hi-Toun, who explains his grief over his missing daughter.

narrative_arcs.title: The King's Grief Over Daughter Lotus's Disappearance

sub_scenes.title: Encounter with Distressed Woman
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo encounters a woman in distress who leads him to a castle.

narrative_arcs.title: Encounter with a Starving Woman and the Witch's Castle

sub_scenes.title: Entering the Witch's Castle
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo and the woman enter the castle, where strange events begin to unfold.

narrative_arcs.title: Entering the Mysterious Castle and Meeting the 'Children'
Imprisonment as a 'Guest' and Ogress Revelation

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation with Ogress
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo confronts the Ogress and her tusked mice.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with Tusked Mice and Ogress's Claws

Major_Arcs.title: Escape from the Ogress's Captivity
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details the story of a young man and woman's captivity by an ogress and their subsequent escape using a magic knife.

sub_scenes.title: Initial Attack and Capture
sub_scenes.description: A cloaked figure attacks a man and captures him with snakes.

sub_scenes.title: Captivity and Hope
sub_scenes.description: An old woman holds captives and threatens to eat them, but hope arises when a captive remembers a knife.

sub_scenes.title: Successful Escape
sub_scenes.description: The captives use a magic knife to escape the ogress.

narrative_arcs.title: The Unexpected Attack and Its Success

Major_Arcs.title: Return to Father and Reward
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details the escaped captives' journey to the woman's father, their reunion, and the young man's reward.

sub_scenes.title: Escape Journey
sub_scenes.description: The young man and woman escape the dungeon and journey to her father.

narrative_arcs.title: Dungeon Escape and Journey to Father

sub_scenes.title: Arrival and Cultural Misunderstanding
sub_scenes.description: They arrive at a place decorated for mourning, which is actually for happiness in their culture.

sub_scenes.title: Father's Joy and Reward
sub_scenes.description: The father is overjoyed and offers a reward, which the young man accepts as a magic knife.

Major_Arcs.title: The Treasure of Agra and Jordan's Revenge
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc tells a story about buried treasure, betrayal, and revenge set in a British penal colony.

sub_scenes.title: Treasure Keeper Prologue and Penal Colony Intro
sub_scenes.description: Introduction to the treasure story by a Treasure Keeper and setting in a British penal colony.

narrative_arcs.title: Penal Colony Routine and Officer's Request

sub_scenes.title: Prisoner's Plea and Captain's Rejection
sub_scenes.description: A prisoner tries to speak to Captain Brooking but is initially rejected.

sub_scenes.title: Treasure Offer and Agreement
sub_scenes.description: The prisoner reveals the treasure and Captain Brooking becomes interested, leading to an agreement.

sub_scenes.title: Betrayal and Vow of Revenge
sub_scenes.description: The prisoner, Joseph Jordan, is betrayed by Captain Brooking and vows revenge.

narrative_arcs.title: Realization of Betrayal and Vow of Revenge
Years Later - Freedom and Undying Vengeance

Major_Arcs.title: Confrontation, Betrayal, and Moral of the Treasure
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc concludes the treasure story with Joseph Jordan confronting Captain Brooking, leading to another betrayal and a final moral lesson.

sub_scenes.title: Jordan's Vigil and Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Joseph Jordan stakes out Captain Brooking's house and confronts him.

sub_scenes.title: Attic Treasure and Betrayal
sub_scenes.description: Inside Brooking's house, Jordan is shown the treasure, but is then betrayed and attacked.

sub_scenes.title: Police Investigation and Moral Conclusion
sub_scenes.description: Police investigate the gunshot, and the story concludes with a moral lesson about treasure.

Major_Arcs.title: The Haunted Matthews Estate and Salvation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc tells a ghost story about a haunted estate, Dr. Styx investigating, and a path to salvation found through forgiveness and brotherly love.

sub_scenes.title: Dr. Styx and the Threat & Court Sentencing
sub_scenes.description: Introduction of Dr. Styx and a courtroom sentencing setting up the haunted estate story.

sub_scenes.title: Discussion about Haunted Estate
sub_scenes.description: Mr. Northrup and Dr. Styx discuss the haunted Matthews estate and Dr. Styx's involvement.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Matthews' Estate and Haunting

sub_scenes.title: Arrival at Matthews Place and Warning
sub_scenes.description: Mr. Northrup arrives at the haunted Matthews Place and receives a warning.

sub_scenes.title: Entering the House and Ghost Encounter
sub_scenes.description: Mr. Northrup ignores the warning and enters the house, encountering Vincent Matthews' ghost.

narrative_arcs.title: Ignoring Alvin's Warning and Entering the House

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Struggle with Ghost
sub_scenes.description: Mr. Northrup confronts and physically struggles with the ghost.

sub_scenes.title: Dialogue on Violence and Salvation
sub_scenes.description: Mr. Northrup and the ghost have a dialogue about violence, fear, and the path to salvation.

narrative_arcs.title: Seeking Guidance and Receiving Advice on Salvation
Revelation of Rosalind as the Key to Salvation

sub_scenes.title: Summoning Rosalind
sub_scenes.description: A figure in red and black forces the white figure to confront Rosalind's spirit.

narrative_arcs.title: Forced Confrontation and Accusation of Cowardice
Physical Restraint and Assertion of Superior Strength

sub_scenes.title: Forgiveness and Brotherly Love Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Rosalind appears and through forgiveness and brotherly love, the curse is broken.

narrative_arcs.title: Accusation and Identification of the Destroyer
Request for a Favor: Permitting Rest
Acceptance of Brotherly Love and Release

sub_scenes.title: Resolution and Departure of Spirits & Explanation
sub_scenes.description: The spirits find peace and depart, and the figure in red and black explains the events.

narrative_arcs.title: Vincent's Remorse and Rosalind's Ultimate Forgiveness

Major_Arcs.title: The Voyages and Fate of Henry Hudson
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc recounts the historical voyages of Henry Hudson, focusing on his search for the Northwest Passage and his tragic fate due to mutiny.

sub_scenes.title: Historical Prologue and Dutch Proposal
sub_scenes.description: Introduction to Henry Hudson's story and his proposal from the Dutch East India Company.

narrative_arcs.title: The Mysterious Fate of Henry Hudson

sub_scenes.title: Crew Discontent and Hudson River Discovery
sub_scenes.description: Hudson's voyage faces crew discontent and leads to the discovery of the Hudson River, which proves not to be the passage.

narrative_arcs.title: Growing Discontent and Demand to Turn South
Entering the Hudson River and False Hope

sub_scenes.title: Decision to Return and Return to Holland
sub_scenes.description: Hudson decides to return to Holland after failing to find the passage in the Hudson River.

narrative_arcs.title: Hudson's Resignation and Decision to Return Home

sub_scenes.title: Second Expedition and Icy Winter
sub_scenes.description: Hudson embarks on a second expedition, this time facing icy Arctic conditions.

narrative_arcs.title: Hudson's Second Expedition and Icy Route

sub_scenes.title: Resumption of Voyage and Mutiny
sub_scenes.description: After wintering in ice, the voyage resumes, but crew discontent leads to mutiny.

narrative_arcs.title: Resumption of Voyage and Crew's Grievances

sub_scenes.title: Hudson Set Adrift and Mutineers' Arrest
sub_scenes.description: Hudson is set adrift by mutineers, who are later arrested upon their return.

Major_Arcs.title: The Arabian Knight and the Rescue Mission
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc tells the story of the Arabian Knight, Hassan, tasked by the Caliph to rescue a kidnapped woman from Tartar horsemen.

sub_scenes.title: Arabian Knight Introduction and Mission Briefing
sub_scenes.description: Introduction of Arabian Knight and his summoning by the Caliph for a rescue mission.

narrative_arcs.title: The Arabian Knight Introduction and Chase
Summoned by the Caliph and The Mission Briefing

sub_scenes.title: Setting off and Oasis Encounter
sub_scenes.description: Hassan sets off on his mission and encounters a deserted oasis and a warning traveler.

narrative_arcs.title: The Deserted Oasis and Tracking the Tartars
Encounter and Warning from a Traveler
Revealing the Rescue and Parting Ways

sub_scenes.title: Infiltrating Tartar Camp and Eavesdropping
sub_scenes.description: Hassan infiltrates the Tartar camp, subdues a sentry, and gathers information by eavesdropping.

sub_scenes.title: Contacting Captive and Discovery
sub_scenes.description: Hassan contacts the captive woman but is discovered by Tartar guards.

sub_scenes.title: Capture and Confrontation with Kurgan
sub_scenes.description: Hassan is captured and brought before Kurgan, the Tartar leader.

sub_scenes.title: Trial by Combat and Agreement
sub_scenes.description: Kurgan proposes a trial by combat, and Hassan negotiates the terms of victory.

sub_scenes.title: The Trial by Combat Action
sub_scenes.description: The trial by combat commences, and Hassan uses unconventional methods to fight.

sub_scenes.title: Resolution and Safe Passage Granted
sub_scenes.description: Hassan wins the combat, and Kurgan honors the agreement, granting safe passage.

narrative_arcs.title: Kurgan's Recognition and Grant of Safe Passage

sub_scenes.title: Farewell and Romantic Climax
sub_scenes.description: Hassan and the woman have a personal moment, culminating in a kiss before parting ways in Bagdad.
